body:
Are you cross-compiling using make or cmake? (or some other way).
What platform are you crosscompiling for?
Please include the commands you ran.
As noted before, the exact commands to reproduce would be helpful.

@jtattermusch  I'm having trouble with cmake not building zlib and c-ares right, which I suspect is related or identical. I ran into this in a project I was just starting: https://github.com/toulouse/grpc_zlib_cares_broken_example

Here are the build steps. Apologies that it's not as minimal as it could be.

# Build commands
```
mkdir build
cd build/
cmake -G Ninja ..
ninja grpc
ninja sqlite
ninja flatbuffers
```
# nm output (only libgrpc_unsecure seems to have any references - all not found - to zlib)
```
toulouse@DevBox:~/ircsrv/build$ ls grpc/src/grpc/*.a
grpc/src/grpc/libgpr.a                  grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc_unsecure.a
grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc_plugin_support.a  grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc++_unsecure.a

toulouse@DevBox:~/ircsrv/build$ nm ./grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc_unsecure.a | grep inflateEnd
                 U inflateEnd
                 U inflateEnd
```
# Build error
```
FAILED: ircsrv
: && /usr/bin/c++     CMakeFiles/ircsrv.dir/src/main.cpp.o  -o ircsrv  zlib/install/lib/libz.a protobuf/src/protobuf/libprotobuf.a sqlite/install/lib/libsqlite.a grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc++_unsecure.a grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc_unsecure.a grpc/src/grpc/libgpr.a flatbuffers/src/flatbuffers/libflatbuffers.a -lpthread && :

```

Interestingly, when adding 
```
+    ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/grpc/src/grpc/third_party/cares/cares/lib/libcares.a
+    ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/grpc/src/grpc/third_party/zlib/libz.a
```
to the CMakeFiles in the repo I provided, the zlib and cares linking issues go away. The odd thing is that zlib (via cmake externalproject instead of grpc/third_party) was already present as the first library:

/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/zlib/install/lib/libz.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/protobuf/src/protobuf/libprotobuf.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/sqlite/install/lib/libsqlite.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc++_unsecure.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/grpc/src/grpc/libgrpc_unsecure.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/grpc/src/grpc/libgpr.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/flatbuffers/src/flatbuffers/libflatbuffers.a;-lpthread;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/grpc/src/grpc/third_party/cares/cares/lib/libcares.a;/home/toulouse/ircsrv/build/grpc/src/grpc/third_party/zlib/libz.a

@toulouse  perhaps it's obvious, but the order or static libs passed to linker matters (so libz.a being listed as first is not helpful):
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45135/why-does-the-order-in-which-libraries-are-linked-sometimes-cause-errors-in-gcc
@toulouse could you please explain further which cmakefile do you add the target linked library to solve the problem?
It's better to describe what libraries GRPC needs under windows and Linux! I also see, that under linux it wants cares library. It's not the same as windows.
@varshanbp  looks like the initial bug is for crosscompilation with make. I'd suggest using `cmake` instead, because it has much better support for crosscompilation.
I build with cmake. GRPC build successfully, but my project got same error when linking... I add zlib.a, libcares.a it doesn't help)

@dontsovcmc , did you manage to resolve the issue? 

@jtattermusch : can we close this issue? (looks like this issue was first reported by @varshanbp and you already recommended using `cmake`. The issue reported by @toulouse seemed to be resolved by changing the order of libs passed to the linker)
@dontsovcmc   if you're still having issues, can you please share the exact list of commands you are running to reproduce the issue (as well as info about your environment)?
I can check it only in September,sorry
